definitions.example: Despite advancing age, his mind was still as sharp as ever.

definitions.definition: The ability to be aware of things.
definitions.example: There was no doubt in his mind that they would win.

definitions.definition: The ability to focus the thoughts.
definitions.example: I can’t keep my mind on what I’m doing.

definitions.definition: Somebody that embodies certain mental qualities.
definitions.example: He was one of history’s greatest minds.
He changed his mind after hearing the speech.
I am of a mind to listen.
I, ______ being of sound mind and body, do hereby [...]

definitions.definition: The non-material substance or set of processes in which consciousness, perception, affectivity, judgement, thinking, and will are based.
definitions.example: The mind is a process of the brain.

definitions.definition: Continual prayer on a dead person's behalf for a period after their death.
definitions.example: a month's [or monthly] mind; a year's mind

definitions.definition: (originally and chiefly in negative or interrogative constructions) To dislike, to object to; to be bothered by.
definitions.example: Do you mind if I smoke?

definitions.definition: To look after, to take care of, especially for a short period of time.
definitions.example: Would you mind my bag for me?

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the imperative) To make sure, to take care (that).
definitions.example: Mind you don't knock that glass over.

definitions.definition: Take note; used to point out an exception or caveat.
definitions.example: I'm not very healthy. I do eat fruit sometimes, mind.

definitions.definition: To attend to, concern oneself with, heed, be mindful of.
definitions.example: You should mind your own business.

definitions.definition: To have in mind; to intend.
To put in mind; to remind.
